qas.question: Which directions does the South Saharan run?

plausible_answers.text: The South Saharan steppe and woodlands

How much rain does Algeria get?
What is between the South Saharan steppe and the hyper-arid Sahara?

context: <b4_0><b5_0><b9_0>The South Saharan steppe<b9_0/> and woodlands<b5_0/> ecoregion<b4_0/> is a narrow band running <a0_0>east and west<a0_0/> between the hyper-arid Sahara and <b13_0>the Sahel savannas<b13_0/> to the south. Movements of the equatorial Intertropical Convergence Zone (ITCZ) bring summer rains during <a1_0><b8_0><b12_0>July and August<b12_0/><b8_0/><a1_0/> which average <a2_0><b11_0>100 to 200 mm<a2_0/> (3.9 to 7.9 in)<b11_0/> but vary greatly from year to year. These <b7_0>rains<b7_0/> sustain summer pastures of grasses and herbs, with dry woodlands and shrublands along seasonal watercourses. This ecoregion covers <a3_0><b6_0><b10_0>1,101,700 km2<b6_0/> (425,400 mi2)<b10_0/><a3_0/> in Algeria, Chad, Mali, Mauritania, and Sudan.
